Struct task_scheduler_t¶

  • Defined in File task_scheduler_t.h

Struct Documentation¶

struct task_scheduler_t¶

Put all emerging trajectories to be calculated on a queue where every process can check for new work. If all processes are finished, the scheduler signals every process to finish up.

Idea: Rank 0 solely distributes tasks and sets any process to busy. Rank 0 sends its own tasks or sends to a process with available work a rank id to send its own tasks to.

Public Functions

task_scheduler_t(const int &rank, const int &n_processes, const int &simulation_mode)¶
bool send_task(checkpoint_t &checkpoint, const bool send_to_self = true)¶

Check if someone is available to send a task from queue to and send it.

Return

True if own queue is where it shall be sent to.

Parameters

  • checkpoint: on out: checkpoint if receiver and sender are the same

  • send_to_self: If true: allow to store checkpoint in checkpoint for further use.

void send_new_task(checkpoint_t &checkpoint)¶

Checks if any worker is free and send it a new task. If all workers are busy, add the task to its queue for later sends.

bool all_free()¶
bool receive_task(checkpoint_t &checkpoint)¶

Busy waiting until a new task is available and returns true. If all processes are waiting, then no more work is available and it returns false, signaling that all processes are finished. Returns immediately if static scheduling is enabled.

Return

False if all processes are finished and there is no new work True if new work had been found and loaded.

void signal_free()¶

Broadcast to other processes that this process is free for work.

void signal_work_avail()¶

Signal to rank 0 how much work is available.

void set_n_ensembles(const int &n)¶
void set_n_trajectories(const int &n)¶
int get_n_ensembles() const¶
int get_n_trajectories() const¶
int get_n_processes() const¶

Public Members

uint64_t current_ens¶
int current_traj¶
std::queue<checkpoint_t> checkpoint_queue¶

A queue of all the available work to send to someone in case all are busy at the moment.

std::vector<int> free_worker¶

A list of all ranks with 0 being busy and 1 free for work. Rank 0 is allowed to set it as busy if it sends a task or allows another rank to send a task. Every other rank can use MPI_Put for its own idx to signal it is free. If free_worker[0] == 2, then all processes are finished.

std::vector<int> work_available¶

Number of work available at rank idx but not sent yet. Rank 0 can reduce it with each signal by one. Each rank can modify its own idx with MPI_Put in case it just took over its own available work or found new one that could not be sent.

uint64_t max_ensemble_id¶

If 1 at idx then send work to process idx. Store the maximum ensemble id that had been created. rank 0: Always has the maximum number at hand. rank > 0: not necessarily up to date.

MPI_Win free_window¶
MPI_Win work_window¶
